description: Dive into "Kodaikanal's Picture-Perfect Escapes" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Kodaikanal's Picture-Perfect Escapes

places.generalDescription: Pine Forest is a picturesque destination featuring tall pine trees, making it a popular spot for activities like horse-riding, leisurely walks, and photography. The area is part of a scenic 2-2.5-hour drive that includes various attractions such as Moir Point, Guna Cave (famous from a movie), Pillar Rocks offering stunning views, and Green Valley View Point providing panoramic vistas.

sources.snippet: The Kodaikanal Pine Forest seems much like a painting that has come to life with its splendid colours and picturesque feel. This is amongst the favourite places to visit in Kodaikanal on every tourist‚Äôs itinerary.It might seem like you are not a part of this planet for the hours that you spend there because the long stretch of just trees will not allow you to gaze at anything else but them. The semblance of the place is fantastic for nature walks, or just to rejuvenate.The Magic mushrooms border these forests in large densities.
sources.shortName: 35 Places to Visit in Kodaikanal, Tourist Places & Attractions

sources.snippet: The Pine Forest in Kodaikanal was cultivated in 1906 and is maintained by the forest department. Walking through the tall slender trunks with sunlight shimmering and a pleasant climate throughout the year gives an unmatched calm and respite from routine life. The Pine Forest has become a haven for passionate photographs thanks to the movie makers as different regional as well as national movies have been shot here.
sources.shortName: 21 Best Places to Visit in Kodaikanal

sources.snippet: If Mr Bryant hadn‚Äôt planted majestic pine trees in 1906, we would have been deprived of such a beautiful piece of nature today. In your Kodaikanal sightseeing tour, Kodaikanal Pine Forest will add delightful vibes to remember for lifetime. Hundreds of pine trees, lush vegetation of mushrooms and scenic and picturesque scenes of nature makes it one of the best sightseeing attractions in Kodaikanal.
sources.shortName: 12 Best Places to Visit in Kodaikanal | Tamil Nadu

sources.snippet: The Mannavanur Lake contributes a sense of serenity to this charming village. Nestled within a sheep farm, the lake offers a stunning vista surrounded by enchanting meadows and distant majestic hills, making it a sight worth capturing. The journey to the lake is equally delightful, with eucalyptus and pine trees lining the road on either side.
sources.shortName: 32 Best Places to Visit in Kodaikanal, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

sources.snippet: The Pine Forest of Kodaikanal was cultivated by one Mr. Bryant about a century ago and today, it happens to be one of the most visited places in the hill station. The Pine Forest attracts a multitude of tourists from all over. Needless to say, that the very sight of umpteen number of pine trees standing tall make for an amazing sight.
sources.shortName: Kodaikanal Tourism- Best Places to Visit in Kodaikanal

sources.snippet: Undeniable one of the most popular sightseeing places in Kodaikanal, Pine Forest attracts enthral visitors. This forest was initially cultivated by Mr. Bryant in 1906. The view of tall Pine trees, creating a thick yet scattered blanket which seems to be touching the clouds, make it an ideal place for capturing pictures and videos.
sources.shortName: 37 Best Places to Visit in Kodaikanal

sources.snippet: Pine Forest Kodaikanal is a picturesque forest reserve located in the enchanting hill station of Kodaikanal. The forest is home to towering pine trees, creating a serene and tranquil atmosphere that attracts nature lovers, picnickers, and photography enthusiasts.
sources.shortName: 18 Places to Visit in Kodaikanal in 2024

sources.snippet: H.D Bryant from Madurai started the development in 1908, of the Pine Forest plantation. He planted the Pine Tree all over the Kodaikanal. Especially from the Solar Observatory plant to Pillar Rock.
sources.shortName: 15 Beautiful Tourist Places In Kodaikanal

sources.snippet: If you think you have seen this place before, you most probably have. A number of movie scenes have been shot here. Pine Forest has a mystical feeling about it.
sources.shortName: Places to Visit in Kodaikanal in 2 Days

sources.snippet: Pine Forests are cloaked in a rustic charm, and walking under the canopy of these old pine trees will offer much-needed solitude for those seeking it.
sources.shortName: Kodaikanal | Hill Stations in Tamil Nadu

places.name: Pine Forest

reviews.text:
The Pine Forest in Kodaikanal is an absolute visit location in a kodaikanal tour. The moment you step in, you're surrounded by towering pine trees and a serene, misty atmosphere that feels straight out of a movie - and rightly so, since it's been a favorite filming location for many popular films over the years.

The Pine forest is peaceful, photogenic, and perfect for a relaxed stroll or just to sit and enjouy  the beauty of nature. The place is planted by british and is well maintained also  it a truly calming experience.

It's a great spot for photography lovers, couples, and families alike. Whether you're looking for a scenic background or just want to unwind in the lap of nature, the Pine Forest won't disappoint.

Highly recommended if you're in Kodaikanal trip..

Loved the calm and cool atmosphere here. Walking among the tall pine trees felt refreshing and peaceful. We took some great photos, and the kids enjoyed running around. There were a few monkeys around, its fun to watch, but we had to be careful with snacks, but they added to the fun experience. It was a bit crowded but still a wonderful place to visit.

‚ö†Ô∏è Please note: The area remains closed during heavy rainfall due to slippery conditions in the forest, so plan your visit accordingly.

üå≤ The trail begins with a few steps leading downward, followed by a scenic walk along a sloping hillside. The views of the lake and surrounding pine trees are absolutely stunning.

üêé Horse riding is available and highly recommended-the hilly terrain makes the experience even more enjoyable. It costs ‚Çπ200 per person, and the staff will take photos and videos using your own phone.

places.address: 6F75+FG4, Lake Rd, Berijam, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624103, India

places.generalDescription: Kurinji Andavar Temple, a vibrant Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Murugan, is located in the picturesque surroundings of Kodaikanal. Built in 1936 by a European lady who embraced Hinduism and changed her name to Leelavathi, this unique site is adorned with colorful Kurinji flowers that bloom once every 12 years. The temple attracts not only devotees but also travelers due to its fascinating history and the annual summer festival celebrated on its grounds.

sources.snippet: If you are in Kodaikanal and want to feel the South culture, then Kurunji Andavar Murugan Temple is one of the famous religious  Kodaikanal sightseeing places. Dedicated to Lord Murugan, the God of Hill, this temple acts as the spiritual link between the hills and the Lord of the residents.It gets the name ‚ÄòKurunji‚Äô from the Kurunji flower that blooms once in twelve years. You can relax in the premise after prayers at the shrub garden or the park area.Location:Kurinji Andavar Temple Road, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624101Timing:07.00AM to 07.00PMEntry Fee: FreeYou can also Checkout: Kodaikanal Tour Packages From Mysore
sources.shortName: 35 Places to Visit in Kodaikanal, Tourist Places & Attractions

sources.snippet: At a distance of 41 Km from Kodaikanal, 108 Km from Coimbatore, and 122 km from Madurai, Palani or Pazhani is a temple town located in the Dindigul district of Tamil Nadu, India. The town of Palani is renowned for Palani Murugan Temple or Arulmigu Dhandayuthapani Swamy Temple. Dedicated to Lord Murugan, it is one of the six revered temples of Lord Murugan in Tamil Nadu, that are collectively referred to as the Arupadaiveedu and is an important pilgrim centre for Hindus that one must visit as part of Kodaikanal tour packages.
sources.shortName: 32 Best Places to Visit in Kodaikanal, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

sources.snippet: Kurinji Andavar Temple is dedicated to Lord Murugan or Kartikeya and is home to the famous kurunji flower which blooms once in 12 years. The temple was established by the European lady in 1936 and after adopting Hinduism is known by the name ‚ÄòLady Ramanathan‚Äô. The temple is a popular among the tourist due to the views of the surroundings and the famous spot of the flower.
sources.shortName: Top 8 Places To Visit In Kodaikanal, The Princess Of Hill Stations

sources.snippet: This Lord Muruga or God of hills temple is one of the most spiritual places to visit in Kodaikanal. You shouldn‚Äôt miss it even if you‚Äôre not religious as the temple offers gorgeous views of the Palani hills and Vaigai Dam. The temple is also popular for the Kurinji flowers that turn the hills into a beautiful purplish blue and grow once every 12 years.
sources.shortName: 70 Places To Visit In Kodaikanal For A Refreshing Getaway

sources.snippet: Kurinji Temple, located in Kodaikanal, is a sacred temple dedicated to Lord Murugan, the Hindu god of war. The temple is named after the Kurinji flower, which blooms once every 12 years in the surrounding hills. Known for its serene ambiance and beautiful architecture, the temple is a popular attraction for devotees and tourists alike.
sources.shortName: 18 Places to Visit in Kodaikanal in 2024

sources.snippet: The temple is dedicated to the Lord Murugan who is referred as 'God of hill'. Just 3 km from the lake, it is very famous for its Kurinji flower which blossoms in the area only once every 12 years. In addition to admiring its marvellous architecture, you can also have an amazing view of the Palani and Vaigai dam from this temple.
sources.shortName: 37 Best Places to Visit in Kodaikanal

sources.snippet: Dedicated to Lord Murugan, the Kurinji Andavar temple is a must visit place in Kodaikanal for pilgrims. Situated at a somewhat offbeat location, the quaint temple offers majestic views of Palani Hills at his backdrop. Tourists can also have a grand view of the Vaigai Dam from the temple.
sources.shortName: Kodaikanal Tourism- Best Places to Visit in Kodaikanal

sources.snippet: Kurinji Andavar Murugan Temple is dedicated to Lord Muruga, the God of Hills, and boasts of traditional South Indian architecture. In Tamil literature, Kuriji means hills and Andavar refers to God. The temple overlooks the beautiful carrot plantations on the terraced slopes.
sources.shortName: 21 Best Places to Visit in Kodaikanal

sources.snippet: Kurinji temple is located at the top of a hill and offers scenic views of the surrounding countryside. The best time to visit is in the summer when the sky is blue and the hills are cloudy. The area is also famous for the Kurinji flower, which blooms every 12 years.
sources.shortName: The Comprehensive Kodaikanal Trip Guide

sources.snippet: Kurinji is a flower where the temple has a lot of Kurinji flowersüåº. It blossoms once in 12 years. The last time it bloomed was in 2018 at that time, many of the tourists enjoyed the view.
sources.shortName: 15 Beautiful Tourist Places In Kodaikanal

sources.snippet: One of the most visited places in Kodaikanal is Kurunji Andavar Murugan Temple. It‚Äôs one of the best Kodaikanal attractions for those who want to feel south culture.
sources.shortName: 25 Best Places To Visit In Kodaikanal With Your Family And Friends 2024
Stunning Places to Visit and Photograph in Kodaikanal, India

places.name: Kurinji Andavar Temple

reviews.text: It's one of the popular places in Kodaikanal. The temple is small yet beautiful and the views from there are spectacular. The temple is maintained well and new hall is being constructed. The roads are tidy and parking space is very limited. There are lots of shops and residences surrounding it. One of the best places in the town.

The main deity is Lord Murugan, also known as Kartikeya or Skanda, is the Hindu god of war and the "God of the hill.
The temple is situated near Kodaikanal Lake in Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu.¬†It is one of the major tourist attraction in kodaikanal.
This temple also contains sannidhis for navagraha, Lord vishnu, and so on. This temple provides a scenic view of kodaikanal Where we can do photoshoot. Best place for traditional couple photoshoot.

Number of shops are available outside the temple where we can purchase home decor items, dolls for children. Some food stalls are also available outside the temple where we can get food for affordable prices.

Ancient devotional place must visit

We went on weekdays no rush in the morning first abisegam üôè very peaceful mind with God vibes

The temple is located in poombarai it was 20 kilometres away from kodikanal bus stand

If you're going by bus means after reaching kodaikanal bus stand you have to take another bus to reach poombarai

Note:- This temple is not near the exact kodaikanal bus stand

places.address: Kurinji Andavar Temple Road, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

places.generalDescription: Dolphin Nose is a prominent rock formation in Kodaikanal that resembles the nose of a dolphin, providing breathtaking views of the surrounding valleys and mountains.

sources.snippet: In Kodaikanal, the Dolphin‚Äôs Nose viewpoint offers stunning views from a flat rock that resembles a dolphin‚Äôs nose, standing tall at 6,600 feet. To reach this spot, you‚Äôll need to trek along a moderate 3 km trail through the Palani Hill Range, passing through pine forests and rocky paths. Along the way, you‚Äôll encounter a nearby waterfall and village, though food options are a bit pricey.
sources.siteName: Muddie Trails - Get Muddie in Travel!
sources.shortName: Places to Visit in Kodaikanal in 2 Days

sources.snippet: Dolphin Nose Point is the best place to trek when you go to Kodaikanal. The whole trek distance will be almost 2 KM. It‚Äôs deep down the way when you‚Äôre going into the Dolphin Nose point.
sources.shortName: 15 Beautiful Tourist Places In Kodaikanal

places.name: Dolphin Nose

reviews.text: Simply awesome !!! Breathtaking view of nature... Which is about an half kilometer hike to reach the destination but not that easy especially the return journey . Not recommended for old age peoples and whose with small kids.The first view point is very beautiful and you need to walk about 200m to reach the dolphin nose shaped rock. You should careful at this point there is no safety measures.

One of the best trekking experiences deep down from top view to bottom view. The place where you can see two solid rocks standing edge of the hill side. Awesome experience bot not suitable for old people who can't climb in solid steps through rocks and roots of the trees.

A very nice place to visit - preferably in the early morning when it's less crowded and more peaceful.

The trekking trail is wonderful, and it turned out to be a great experience with friends. Perfect spot for nature lovers and adventure seekers!

places.generalDescription: Coakers Walk, established in 1872, is a 1-km paved pedestrian path that provides stunning panoramic views of Kodaikanal's natural beauty. This attraction offers breathtaking vistas of Berijam Lake, Bryant Park, Kurinjiandavar Temple, and other scenic spots. Nestled in the Tamil Nadu mountains, this man-made walking plaza is an ideal location for leisurely strolls while immersing oneself in the tranquility of nature.

sources.snippet: If you want to see with your own eyes the epitome of beauty on Earth, then you should know that Coaker‚Äôs Walk is the highlight of the tourist places in Kodaikanal. Driving through the mountains is one experience, but walking an entire kilometre on that path while you look at the lush green mountains on the other end is something else.City people use this path for morning and evening walks. The telescope House escalates the view of the valley, even though chargeable, it is grandeur!
sources.shortName: 35 Places to Visit in Kodaikanal, Tourist Places & Attractions

sources.snippet: Coakers Walk is one place you must visit when in Kodaikanal. It is a 1 kilometre long pathway constructed on the slopes of a hillock and is one of the most serene places you will ever visit in India. The kilometre long walk provides the most picturesque views of the hills and a rare phenomenon where your shadow is cast on the clouds that envelop the area called ‚Äò Brocken Spectre‚Äô can be witnessed.
sources.shortName: Top 8 Places To Visit In Kodaikanal, The Princess Of Hill Stations

sources.snippet: Coaker‚Äôs Walk in Kodaikanal is a 1 km path where tourists love to walk in the morning and evening to enjoy the views of hills, plateaus, and rivers, especially during sunsets and sunrises. Built by Lieutenant Coaker in 1972, it‚Äôs close to the bus stand and railway station, and near Kodaikanal Lake. The path starts near Van Allen Hospital and goes past St. Peter‚Äôs Church, with fences for safety.
sources.siteName: Muddie Trails - Get Muddie in Travel!
sources.shortName: Places to Visit in Kodaikanal in 2 Days

sources.snippet: Kodaikanal is a tourist destination that shows off the scenic beauty of nature in its purest form. Coaker‚Äôs Walk, one of Kodaikanal‚Äôs main tourist destinations, best embodies this natural beauty.
sources.shortName: 25 Best Places To Visit In Kodaikanal With Your Family And Friends 2024
18 Places to Visit in Kodaikanal in 2024

places.name: Coakers Walk

reviews.text: Excellent location for mountain views; you can even use binoculars to see Madurai from there.  There is a tiny store where you may eat and purchase magnets.  However, the parking is not up to pace outside.  When parking cars, everyone is facing. If possible go by evening it will be a wonderful sky by luck.

Awesome place to view the Theni district plains. We went here towards late March, and we were lucky to have little or no fog or clouds to hinder our view. I would definitely recommend this place to everyone who comes here. Two points of improvement - cleanliness can be maintained, especially on the entrance, and the route can be renovated, due to broken tiles.

Good place with amazing views, but it would be great if the government could provide drinking water facilities. No bottled water available in nearby shops either. Visitors would appreciate this basic need."

places.address: 6FHV+XGC, Coakers Walk, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

places.generalDescription: Green Valley Viewpoint is one of the most photographed tourist attractions in Kodaikanal. It offers a panoramic view of hills, valleys and plains making it look surreal. You can also see the Vaigai dam from here. However, access to this place is now restricted due to its popularity among tourists.

sources.snippet: A post shared by SAMEE PHOTOGRAPHY (@sameejpg) on May 26, 2020 at 11:47am PDT. Green Valley View Point is one of those Kodaikanal places which gives you a panoramic view of the hills, valleys and plains, making it look surreal. One can also see the Vaigai dam from here which is cool.
sources.shortName: Places to Visit in Kodaikanal in 2 Days

places.name: Green Valley Viewpoint

reviews.text: I felt this very cute because as you enter there are plenty of shops to your right and left so walking all this feels amazing and reaching the view after crossing all the shops gives more excitement.

Old name of that place is suicide point and new name is Green Valley View. No entry fee is there and parking space available outside the main gate. During my visit time it is overcrowded and pathway towards spot occupied by vendors with different types of products. When you passing through this area feel like shoping place. View point covered with big iron barricade for safety purpose but scenic view is very good.

I went to the view point but I didnt see the green valley.

* Entry fee 10INR
* April ending and May month might be the right time to visit to explore viewpoints.
* But Fog and that chillness also a great experience in the queen of hills

places.generalDescription: Bryant Park, located in the picturesque hill station of Kodaikanal, is a 20-acre botanical garden established in 1908. Maintained by the Department of Horticulture, it features a glasshouse, lush lawns, colorful flower beds, and a pond with water lilies. The park boasts an extensive collection of rose bushes, cacti, shrubs, and rare tree species.

sources.snippet: Bryant Park is definitely one of the most popular attractions in Kodaikanal. If Kodaikanal is nature‚Äôs treat, Bryant Park is the dessert. Bryant Park is a botanical park and is home to a wide variety of flowers, hybrids and grafts.
sources.shortName: Top 32 Amazing Places to Visit in Kodaikanal

sources.snippet: Just east of the serene Kodaikanal Lake is an equally captivating site called Bryant Park ‚Äì a botanical garden which gives you a chance to behold the majesty of nature in all it...
sources.shortName: 18 Tourist Places in Kodaikanal 2024: Entry Fee, Timings

places.name: Bryant Park

reviews.text:
Bryant Park is an absolute gem, and a visit here truly feels like stepping into a tranquil oasis right in the heart of the city. From the moment I entered, I was struck by its incredible beauty and lush greenery. The meticulously maintained lawns and vibrant trees created such a picturesque setting that I honestly felt transported to a charming European country. It's rare to find such a peaceful and aesthetically pleasing place that offers such a delightful escape from urban hustle.
Beyond its stunning appearance, the park is remarkably neat and clean, which significantly adds to its appeal. Even the washroom facilities were impeccably maintained, which is always a welcome sign and speaks volumes about the care taken in the park's upkeep.
Bryant Park is a must-visit for anyone seeking a serene and beautiful environment. It's a perfect spot for a leisurely stroll, a quiet read, or simply to soak in the peaceful atmosphere. I can't recommend it enough!

Located next to the Kodaikanal lake and below the Coakers walk, Bryant park is a nicely maintained botanical garden. The park is maintained by department of horticulture, Tamilnadu. Entry fee is ‚Çπ50 which is little high.the park has a green house and nursery of its own. A nice place to spend some time with family, especially with children. One different flavours of the park depending on the season of the travel. Nice place for nature lovers and photographers.

Bryant park is nothing but a overrated park...which is averagely maintained in terms of recreation....The garden was pleasant but nothing particularly special. It had some nice greenery but overall it lacked  standout features. While it was a relaxing place to walk around, it didn't leave a lasting impression. . Lot to be developed to actually convert this place as an attraction...the only impressive part was the weather which had a out of the world experience particularly walking alongside clouds.A decent spot for a short visit, but not something I'd go out of my way to see again.

places.address: 6FJV+H7W, Lower Shola Rd, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

places.generalDescription: Silver Cascade Falls is a captivating natural wonder that serves as the welcoming attraction to Kodaikanal on the Madurai-Kodai road. This picturesque waterfall, standing at over 180 feet high, offers a mesmerizing experience with its bubbling waters cascading over rocks. Located just 8 kilometers from Kodaikanal's main town, it is easily accessible and requires no walking or trekking.

sources.snippet: The Silver Cascade Falls, situated just 8 km from Kodaikanal Bus Station, is a must-visit spot on your journey from Kodaikanal to Madurai. Cascading down from a height of 180 feet, this mesmerizing waterfall is formed by the overflow of the famous Kodai Lake, offering a refreshing break during your long road trip. The sight of water rushing down with sheer strength is captivating, and you can even take a dip in the waters if the temperature is suitable.
sources.siteName: Muddie Trails - Get Muddie in Travel!
sources.shortName: Places to Visit in Kodaikanal in 2 Days

sources.snippet: If you happen to arrive at Kodaikanal from Madurai, you are in for a mesmerizing welcome. The 180 feet high Silver Cascade Waterfall is the first attraction in town with the sound of water gushing over the rocks. The Silver Cascade Fall is unique in the sense that it does not require any walking or trekking as it is located right next to the road!!
sources.shortName: 21 Best Places to Visit in Kodaikanal

sources.snippet: Silver Cascade Falls, located approximately 8 kilometers from Kodaikanal, is a beautiful waterfall that offers a refreshing retreat amidst lush green forests and misty hills. The cascading waters of the falls create a picturesque setting, making it a popular tourist attraction for nature lovers and photography enthusiasts.
sources.shortName: 18 Places to Visit in Kodaikanal in 2024

sources.snippet: Silver Cascade Falls gets its water from the over flowing Kodai-lake with water falling from a height of 180m. As a result of its magnificence and beauty it has become one of the popular tourist places in Kodaikanal. If the temperature is right and the weather gods are with you, one can go for a dip as well.
sources.shortName: Top 32 Amazing Places to Visit in Kodaikanal

sources.snippet: At a distance of 8 km from Kodaikanal Bus Station, Silver Cascade is a mesmerizing waterfall situated in the town of Kodaikanal. This is one of the most popular waterfalls near Bangalore and among the prime place to visit on a Kodaikanal trip.
sources.shortName: 32 Best Places to Visit in Kodaikanal, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

sources.snippet: The Silver Cascade Waterfall resembles its name in every essence. It is a pit stop on the way to Madurai, and it claims one‚Äôs scenic attention like nothing else!. Falling from a humongous height of 180ft, this pour is unimaginably ethereal.
sources.shortName: 35 Places to Visit in Kodaikanal, Tourist Places & Attractions

sources.snippet: Falling from a height of 180 feet while creating a sight to behold, Silver Cascade Falls is aptly named so. It gets its water from the Kodai Lake. The excess water of the lake falls from a steep rock and eventually forms a water pool.
sources.shortName: 37 Best Places to Visit in Kodaikanal

sources.snippet: Although a number of waterfalls are located within a short drive of Kodaikanal, Silver Cascade Falls is often the first one from the list that tourists choose to visit during th...
sources.shortName: 18 Tourist Places in Kodaikanal 2024: Entry Fee, Timings

sources.snippet: Kodaikanal Lake, Silver Cascade Falls, Bryant Park and Dolphins Nose are just a few of the many points of interest in Kodaikanal.
sources.shortName: 25 Best Places To Visit In Kodaikanal With Your Family And Friends 2024

places.name: Silver Cascade Falls

reviews.text: The waterfall is next to the toll plaza and one can visit while entering the kodaikanal city or while exiting. It is about 5 KM from city center. There are a lot of shops around, mostly not useful with unhygienic street food but place itself is wonderful, with ample parking on road side. During rainy season, one can find amazing view with lot of water coming down the falls.

We didn't find any ticket window here. No entrance fee. We could watch it from the side of road.
Washroom is available but not clean.
Water fall presents enchanting view.
There are several vendors selling food items.
And don't forget troops of monkey in search of food. Take care and be safe.

It is one of the first attractions in the kodaikanal trip when we travells through  palani - kodaikanal route. I was surprised that the Waterfall have  plenty of water even in late April that was amazing. We can spend 10 to 20 minutes here.which is surrounded by lush green natural forest.From there we can know the major attractions in kodaikanal , and distance from the spot.There is  entry fee for entering the falls and we can also enjoy it from road also.

places.generalDescription: Liril Falls, also known as Phambar Falls, is a small and picturesque stepped waterfall located in Kodaikanal. Its flow varies depending on the season, offering visitors a different experience throughout the year. This popular viewpoint gained fame as the backdrop for the iconic Liril soap advertisement, and it continues to attract tourists seeking its natural beauty. The trek to reach the falls spans about 1.

sources.snippet: Liril falls emerged from Kodaikanal Township Reservior near Kodaikanal Solar Observatory and comes through the Fairy waterfalls. It is 2.5KM away from the Kodaikanal LakeüèûÔ∏è or bus stand. So, you can book a call taxi, bus or auto-rickshaw to reach the falls.
sources.shortName: 15 Beautiful Tourist Places In Kodaikanal

places.name: Liril Falls

reviews.text:
This is a must visit place in Kodaikanal.

Liril Falls in Kodaikanal is a small yet picturesque waterfall, surrounded by lush greenery. The spot became famous due to the iconic Liril soap advertisement. While the falls look beautiful during the monsoon, water flow can be minimal in other seasons. The area is not well-maintained, and access can be tricky. Overall, it's a decent stop but not a must-visit compared to other waterfalls in Kodaikanal.

Scenic waterfalls with ice cold water. Recommend coming here.
We stopped here for about an hour and dipped our legs the in the clear and cold water. The waterfall flow wasn't that fierce but it was enjoyable nevertheless.
The drive to this place was devoid of traffic and we did find free street parking as well.
Recommend coming here for a short stop.

A small tinywiny waterfall on Levinge Stream. It creates illusion of some one running this waterfall using a hose pipe üòÑ. Water level increases to give it a look of proper small waterfall in rainy seasons only. The place is surrounded by some shops mostly selling home made chocolate. Free parking for upto ten cars

places.address: 6FCJ+GQ6, Golf Links Road, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

places.generalDescription: Guna Cave, also known as Devil's Kitchen, is a popular natural attraction discovered in 1821. It is nestled between three massive pillar-shaped rocks and offers a unique adventure for visitors. The area also features the Silver Cascade Waterfall, providing a mesmerizing sight for children to enjoy. Despite being covered with steel mesh, the cave's mysterious rock formations and winding passages continue to captivate adventurers.

sources.snippet: The Guna Caves in Kodaikanal have an engrossing history; it is believed that the Pandavas used to cook their meals in these caves, and hence it was initially called The Devil‚Äôs Kitchen. The name was later changed in the ‚Äô90s when the film Guna was shot here.The caves are hugged by three gigantic rock pillars and are sheltered by the Shola trees. It is a place that some find risky, and some find rousing due to its altitude, steep drops, and cliffs.
sources.shortName: 35 Places to Visit in Kodaikanal, Tourist Places & Attractions

sources.snippet: Guna Caves, also known as Devil‚Äôs Kitchen, are a captivating tourist attraction near Pillar Rocks in Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu. Situated about 10 kilometers from Kodaikanal along the Moir Point road, these caves offer a unique blend of natural beauty and mysterious allure. Visitors can‚Äôt venture inside due to safety reasons but can admire the caves from a safe distance amidst the picturesque surroundings of Shola trees and lush grass.
sources.siteName: Muddie Trails - Get Muddie in Travel!
sources.shortName: Places to Visit in Kodaikanal in 2 Days

sources.snippet: The list of places would remain incomplete without a mention of the Guna caves. Discovered in 1821 CE by BS Ward, an English officer, the cave remained hidden from the tourists for many years till 1991 when a Tamil movie ‚ÄòGuna‚Äô, that starred the famous actor Kamal Hassan changed its fate. Located 12 km away from Kodainal, Guna caves is one of the best places to visit near Kodaikanal.
sources.shortName: 70 Places To Visit In Kodaikanal For A Refreshing Getaway

sources.snippet: Situated amidst thick forest on hilltop behind Pillar Rocks, Guna Caves is one of the top visited places in Kodaikanal. The path to Guna Cave passes through a beautiful pine forest with roots of the trees emerged on to the ground providing unique setting to this place. Apart from the historical importance, the beauty of the nature makes it a popular tourist spot in Kodaikanal.
sources.shortName: 32 Best Places to Visit in Kodaikanal, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

sources.snippet: Named after a popular actor Kamal Hassan‚Äôs Tamil movie Guna, which was shot here, these caves are also known as Devil‚Äôs Kitchen. Located on the Pillar Rocks Road, Guna Caves are an interesting place to visit in Kodaikanal. These Caves are primarily three huge rock pillars which stand attached to each other and are surrounded by the Shola trees.
sources.shortName: 37 Best Places to Visit in Kodaikanal

sources.snippet: One of the most interesting tourist places to visit in Kodaikanal is the Guna Caves. Named after a famed Kamal Hassan starrer Tamil movie Guna, the caves are a must visit place for nature lover and adventure seekers. The region was a well-known hiking trail and after the movie was shot, it came to be known as Guna Caves.
sources.shortName: Kodaikanal Tourism- Best Places to Visit in Kodaikanal

sources.snippet: Tucked amidst the Pillar Rocks, the clouds surrounding the Guna Caves gives it a mysterious feel. Discovered by an English Officer, B.S. Ward in 1821CE, Guna Caves were known as Devil‚Äôs Kitchen. Since the Tamil movie ‚ÄúGuna‚Äù was shot here, the caves have been popularly known as the Guna Caves.
sources.shortName: Places to Visit in Kodaikanal in 2 Days

sources.snippet: Surrounded by Shola trees, Guna caves is one of the most interesting and popular travel destinations in Kodaikanal. It is named after a popular Tamil movie named Guna which was shot here. Guna Caves are actually formed by three rock pillars of a mountain.
sources.shortName: 12 Best Places to Visit in Kodaikanal | Tamil Nadu

sources.snippet: Situated at an altitude of 2,200 metres, the Guna Caves are a thing of mystery and wonder that attracts travellers in hordes. Known earlier as 'Devil‚Äôs Kitchen', the place got its name 'Guna' after the 1992 Tamil blockbuster movie ‚ÄúGuna'' was shot here.
sources.shortName: Kodaikanal | Hill Stations in Tamil Nadu

sources.snippet: It is a beautiful sightseeing place in Kodaikanal, which is famous for its 3 Pillar-type Rocks. Guna caves were earlier known as Devils Kitchen. It is a thrilling cave where 15+ adults lost their lives trying to get inside the cave.
sources.shortName: 15 Beautiful Tourist Places In Kodaikanal

sources.snippet: The Guna caves is situated at an altitude of 2230 meters above sea level and was discovered by an English Officer named B.
sources.shortName: 21 Best Places to Visit in Kodaikanal

places.name: Guna Cave

reviews.text: Visiting Guna Cave was an absolutely amazing experience! The natural beauty and the eerie, captivating atmosphere of the place are truly unforgettable. It's even more fascinating to see it in person after hearing about its fame, especially with the recent popularity from the Malayalam movie 'Manjummel Boys.' The film beautifully captured the essence of the caves, and being there felt like stepping into a part of cinematic history. Whether you're a nature lover, a movie buff, or just looking for a unique adventure, Guna Cave is a must-visit destination. Highly recommended!

Guna Caves is a wonderful place to visit! The caves are surrounded by beautiful greenery and huge trees, making it a perfect spot for nature lovers. The caves themselves are very interesting, with unique rock formations that are a result of millions of years of natural processes. The atmosphere inside the caves is mysterious and calm, making it a great place to relax and unwind. The history and mythology behind the caves are also very fascinating, adding to their charm. The scenic views from the surrounding hills are amazing, and you can take some great photos there. Overall, Guna Caves is a must-visit destination for anyone who loves nature, adventure, and exploring new places. It's a great spot to connect with nature and experience the beauty of the Western Ghats. I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a peaceful and exciting getaway.

Guna Cave is a mysterious and scenic spot in Kodaikanal. The caves are closed with fencing, but the surrounding pine forest and the twisted roots of old trees look truly magical. Walking among them feels like stepping into a fantasy movie. No entry ticket needed, and it's a great place for photos and peaceful vibes. üå≤‚ú®

places.address: Pillar Rocks Rd, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624103, India

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the scenic Palani Hills, the Kodaikanal Solar Observatory Museum is a fascinating destination for anyone intrigued by astronomy. This remarkable facility is designed to facilitate detailed studies of solar phenomena, making it an ideal spot for professionals seeking precise cosmic observations. The observatory operates during daylight hours, ensuring minimal disturbances while observing the sun's activities. It also boasts an extensive library filled with invaluable data and hosts numerous national and international conferences throughout the year.

sources.snippet: Sited in the Palani Hills, Kodaikanal Solar Observatory is built in a manner that aids in the study of the solar actions. Professionals use this place to find the most accurate cosmic observations because the placement of the observatory helps to study the sun in an undisturbed manner; this is why it open only during the day.A lot of national and international conferences are conducted here; it is bejewelled with a lot of data that is stored in its larger than life library. If you can pull some strings, then you may get special permission for star gazing at night, but that is subject to the officials.Location:Near Govt Rose Garden, Observatory Rd, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624103Timings:10.00AM to 12.00PM, 02.00PM to 04.00PM (From April to June); 10.00AM to 12.00PM during other months (Only on Fridays)Entry Fee: FreeMust Read: Best Homestays in Kodaikanal
sources.shortName: 35 Places to Visit in Kodaikanal, Tourist Places & Attractions

sources.snippet: At a distance of 41 Km from Kodaikanal, 108 Km from Coimbatore, and 122 km from Madurai, Palani or Pazhani is a temple town located in the Dindigul district of Tamil Nadu, India. The town of Palani is renowned for Palani Murugan Temple or Arulmigu Dhandayuthapani Swamy Temple. Dedicated to Lord Murugan, it is one of the six revered temples of Lord Murugan in Tamil Nadu, that are collectively referred to as the Arupadaiveedu and is an important pilgrim centre for Hindus that one must visit as part of Kodaikanal tour packages.
sources.shortName: 32 Best Places to Visit in Kodaikanal, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

sources.snippet: Perched atop the Kodai Hill at a staggering height of 7700 feet, the Kodaikanal Solar Observatory is a beacon of scientific exploration in the serene Palani Hills. Established in 1899 and boasting the largest collection of solar data dating back to the 19th century, it‚Äôs a key player in solar research. Equipped with cutting-edge tools like the Doppler and seismograph, the observatory, manned by a dedicated team, delves into the mysteries of solar behavior.
sources.siteName: Muddie Trails - Get Muddie in Travel!
sources.shortName: Places to Visit in Kodaikanal in 2 Days

sources.snippet: Located at a point 2,343 meters above sea level the Kodaikanal Solar Observatory is at the highest location at Kodaikanal. The observations first commenced in 1901 here and it was founded on 1st April, 1899. The spot not only offers various scientific attractions to its visitors but also provides the most breathtaking views from the top.
sources.shortName: Top 8 Places To Visit In Kodaikanal, The Princess Of Hill Stations

sources.snippet: The Kodaikanal Solar Observatory was established in 1899 and is managed by the Indian Institute of Astrophysics. The small, domed white building is located at the southern tip of Palani Hills. The walk to the observatory in itself is rewarding and the place is a heaven for science lovers.
sources.shortName: 21 Best Places to Visit in Kodaikanal

sources.snippet: Here is where professionals go to find the most precise cosmic observations. It is another one of the best places in Kodaikanal.
sources.shortName: 18 Places to Visit in Kodaikanal in 2024
25 Best Places To Visit In Kodaikanal With Your Family And Friends 2024

places.name: Kodaikanal Solar Observatory Museum

reviews.text:
"I recently visited the Solar Physics Observatory Museum in Kodaikanal, and it was an enlightening experience. The museum showcases the history of solar observations and research in Kodaikanal, with a collection of vintage telescopes, photographs, and artifacts.

The highlight of the visit was the Ca Kodaikanal telescope, which is still functional and offers stunning views of the sun. The knowledgeable staff were happy to answer our questions and provide insights into the history and significance of the observatory.

The museum is a must-visit for anyone interested in astronomy, science, and history. The scenic location amidst the pine forests of Kodaikanal adds to the charm.

*Tips:*

- Plan your visit during the morning or late afternoon for the best views of the sun.
- Don't miss the opportunity to see the Ca Kodaikanal telescope in action.
- Take a guided tour to get the most out of your visit.

*Recommendation:* A must-visit for anyone interested in astronomy and science."
Ticket for Adults - 50 Rs, for kids it's FREE.

Open to public, tickets cost ‚Çπ50/- (only cash payment)
They observe black spots in the sun.
They show some demo also. But you're not allowed to the telescope!
They have detailed explanations about solar systems and charts. Very useful for people studying these things.
Quite an uphill walk from main gate to museum. They don't allow your vehicle inside.
No toilets and water available.

I visited the Kodaikanal Observatory Museum and was fascinated by its rich history and scientific significance! The museum showcases an impressive collection of astronomical instruments and equipment, offering a glimpse into the observatory's groundbreaking research. The exhibits are well-maintained and informative, making it an engaging experience for both science enthusiasts and casual visitors. The observatory's scenic surroundings and tranquil atmosphere add to the museum's charm. A must-visit attraction in Kodaikanal.

places.address: 6FJ8+V5C, Observatory Rd, near Govt Rose Garden, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624103, India

places.generalDescription: Vattakanal mini falls is a picturesque spot located in the village of Vattakanal, approximately 5 km from Kodaikanal. The falls are nestled amidst lush greenery and offer a magical experience with its white water cascading down into a pool where visitors can swim. Many travelers opt to hike up the waterfall to admire the surrounding beauty. This hidden gem is somewhat secluded from the main road, providing a serene atmosphere with few tourists around.

sources.snippet: A post shared by suren_sats photography (@suren_sats_photography). One of the popular Kodaikanal falls, is Vattakanal Falls. The white water flowing from above with the greenery all around, really gives it a magical touch.
sources.shortName: Top 32 Amazing Places to Visit in Kodaikanal
25 Best Places To Visit In Kodaikanal With Your Family And Friends 2024

places.name: Vattakanal Waterfalls

reviews.text: One of the best places to visit in Kodai. We had lot of fun. The water was chilled, but the view was mesmerizing

Decent Waterfalls that comes on the way to Dolphins Nose. The roads are narrow and get difficult when the visibility is low. There are some shops near the place where you can get something to eat or drink. The Waterfalls is good not great. Decent place to stop by before or after visiting Dolphin Nose. Must be careful as it's slippery at the Waterfalls. Would recommend this place.

We visited Vattakkanal Waterfalls, and it's more like a gentle stream with rocks rather than a majestic waterfall. While it's not suitable for bathing, it's a great spot for capturing photos.

Be cautious, as the rocks can be extremely slippery!

Overall, it's a quick and scenic stop, perfect for nature lovers

places.generalDescription: Vattakanal Waterfalls, located just 3 km from Kodaikanal, is a stunning natural attraction known for its rich biodiversity and picturesque surroundings. The falls are nestled amidst lush greenery, hills, and trees, providing a perfect setting for nature enthusiasts to admire the beauty of the area. Visitors can capture memorable moments on the bridge near the falls and explore nearby trekking options at Dolphin Nose point.

sources.snippet: From the Kodaikanal Township Reservoir, the water goes via Fairy falls, Liril falls and give a beautiful origin to Vattakanal Waterfalls. The Vattakanal Waterfalls is small in size but surrounded by trees hence no stopping for enjoyment and sightseeing. Also, trekking is available in Dolphin Nose point, which is very near to the Vattakanal Waterfalls.
sources.shortName: 15 Beautiful Tourist Places In Kodaikanal

places.name: Vattakanal Waterfalls

reviews.text: One of the best places to visit in Kodai. We had lot of fun. The water was chilled, but the view was mesmerizing

Decent Waterfalls that comes on the way to Dolphins Nose. The roads are narrow and get difficult when the visibility is low. There are some shops near the place where you can get something to eat or drink. The Waterfalls is good not great. Decent place to stop by before or after visiting Dolphin Nose. Must be careful as it's slippery at the Waterfalls. Would recommend this place.

We visited Vattakkanal Waterfalls, and it's more like a gentle stream with rocks rather than a majestic waterfall. While it's not suitable for bathing, it's a great spot for capturing photos.

Be cautious, as the rocks can be extremely slippery!

Overall, it's a quick and scenic stop, perfect for nature lovers

places.generalDescription: Upper Lake View is a popular tourist spot in Kodaikanal, located about 3.2 km from Coakers Walk. It offers a stunning panoramic view of the star-shaped Kodaikanal Lake and the lush green surroundings. The overlook point provides an excellent vantage point to admire the natural beauty of the area.

sources.snippet: Located near Coaker‚Äôs Walk, at a distance of 3.2 km, Upper Lake View is the place you can visit to get a memorable view of not just the hill station but also of the lake. Once here, you can watch the star shaped lake from above, and fall in love with its unparalleled beauty. The lushness around and the sparkling water amidst it make the view exceptional.
sources.shortName: 37 Best Places to Visit in Kodaikanal

sources.snippet: The Mannavanur Lake contributes a sense of serenity to this charming village. Nestled within a sheep farm, the lake offers a stunning vista surrounded by enchanting meadows and distant majestic hills, making it a sight worth capturing. The journey to the lake is equally delightful, with eucalyptus and pine trees lining the road on either side.
sources.shortName: 32 Best Places to Visit in Kodaikanal, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

places.name: Upper Lake View

reviews.text:
The Upper Lake View in Kodaikanal is a stunning vantage point that offers a breathtaking panoramic view of the famous Kodaikanal Lake. It's a spot where nature's beauty unfolds in all its glory, making it a must-visit for anyone exploring this hill station.

What makes Upper Lake View so beautiful:

Bird's-eye view of Kodai Lake-  From this viewpoint, you can clearly see the star-shaped Kodaikanal Lake surrounded by lush green hills  a mesmerizing sight, especially during sunrise or sunset.

Rolling hills and misty valleys-The cool mountain breeze and the mist hovering over the hills add a dreamy, almost magical feel to the place.

Sunrise and sunset magic- The changing hues of the sky  golden at dawn and fiery orange at dusk  reflect beautifully on the lake's surface, creating a picture-perfect moment.
We took a private cab, and the driver shared some information about the spot. He mentioned that the lake view resembles the map of India, but we couldn't really see it clearly or make out the shape.

Lake View Point is one of those places where you just stop for a few minutes but end up remembering it for long. From here you can see the full star-shaped Kodaikanal lake shining between the hills-it feels like a painting. The cool breeze and peaceful atmosphere make it a perfect spot to just stand quietly and enjoy.

It's not a big area, but the view is really worth it. Best time is morning or evening when the light makes the lake even more beautiful and there are fewer crowds. You'll also find small tea shops nearby which make the moment even better. For photos, this is definitely one of the best points in Kodaikanal.

Overall, it's a short stop, but the view gives you a complete Kodaikanal vibe-calm, fresh, and memorable.

places.address: 6FJG+45X, Upper Lake Rd, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624103, India

places.generalDescription: CSI Christ the King Church in Kodaikanal is a stunning Gothic-style church with an elaborate bell tower and rose window. It's one of the oldest churches in town, along with St. Peter's Church and La Salette Church. A leisurely walk from the church leads to Vattakanal, passing by Pambar Falls, also known as Liril Falls due to its iconic advertisement shoot.

sources.snippet: Constructed in the year of 1895, Christ the King Church is the one of the oldest Protestant churches in Kodaikanal. Presenting a traditional gothic architecture in granite stones, this church is worth exploring even if you are not religiously inclined. Interiors of the church are also equally captivating with wooden benches, and painted glass windows.
sources.shortName: 37 Best Places to Visit in Kodaikanal

sources.snippet: Another major place of worship, Christ the King Church attracts a lot of tourists and pilgrims round the year. Built in 1895, the Protestant church is constructed in a traditional gothic architecture. The church features a range of stained glasses that exude beauty and liveliness from its exterior.
sources.shortName: Kodaikanal Tourism- Best Places to Visit in Kodaikanal

places.name: CSI Christ the King Church Kodaikanal

reviews.text: I had the privilege of visiting the CSI Christ the King Church in Kodaikanal, and it was a truly enriching experience. This beautiful church, with its stunning architecture and serene atmosphere, is a haven for spiritual seekers and those looking for a peaceful retreat. The church's history, dating back to the British era, adds to its charm.

One of the most beautiful churches I have ever seen. I just happened to be in the area on a Sunday morning and went inside. The mass was taking place with sermons going on, but I could help admire the beautiful wooden interiors, colourful glass windows and the overall tranquil vibe of the church.
An old church right by the entrance to Bryant Park and Coaker's Walk, it is a Protestant church part of the Church of South India located in Kodaikanal.

places.address: Club Rd, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

places.generalDescription: Chettiar Park in Kodaikanal is a serene outdoor retreat managed by the township, offering beautifully landscaped lawns adorned with colorful flowers and well-kept trees. The park is a favorite among nature lovers and photography enthusiasts, boasting a variety of flora including the rare Kurinji Flowers that bloom once every 12 years, creating a stunning display of purple hues. Visitors can also enjoy the peaceful ambiance while strolling through the park or letting children play in the playground.

sources.snippet: Situated on the route to the Kurinji Andavar Temple, Chettiar Park in Kodaikanal is a delightful destination for nature lovers and photography enthusiasts alike. Managed by the township, this tranquil park boasts a profusion of colorful flowers, including the rare Kurinji Flowers that bloom every 12 years, creating a spectacle of purple hues. Visitors can stroll through the well-kept lawns, admire the meticulously shaped bushes, and bask in the serene ambiance of this scenic spot.
sources.siteName: Muddie Trails - Get Muddie in Travel!
sources.shortName: Places to Visit in Kodaikanal in 2 Days

sources.snippet: A stunning green garden, the Chettiar Park happens to be a widespread tourist attraction in the hill station of Kodaikanal. The park is awash with a wide and rare species of flowers, the park is known to exude exquisiteness at every step. The perfectly manicured lawns of the park add on to exquisiteness of the place.
sources.shortName: Kodaikanal Tourism- Best Places to Visit in Kodaikanal

sources.snippet: Manicured lawns, and an extensive range of flowering plants greet visitors at the Chettiar Park. The major attraction however are the Kurinji flowers in the park, that bloom once in 12 years. Nestled on the north eastern corner of the hill station, this park is around 3 km away from the Kodaikanal Bus Stand.
sources.shortName: 37 Best Places to Visit in Kodaikanal

sources.snippet: Chettiar Park, situated about 3km from Kodaikanal, is a relatively small park. Most popular for its Kurinji Flower that blooms every 12 years, Chettiar Park is a good picnic spot amongst the nature. The park is enroute to Kurinji Andavar Temple and boasts a wide range of flowering plants.
sources.shortName: Top 32 Amazing Places to Visit in Kodaikanal

sources.snippet: One of the beautiful attractions in Kodaikanal, this park could be visited any day of the week. It is located at a distance of 3.2 KM from the main Bus stand. You can visit this when you are heading towards or coming back from Kurunji Temple as it is on the way to it.
sources.shortName: 35 Places to Visit in Kodaikanal, Tourist Places & Attractions

sources.snippet: Chettiar Park is a beautiful park located near Kurinji Andavar temple. It is best known for its well-manicured bonsai trees, gardens and tranquil atmosphere. The park is also home to a variety of flora and fauna, which makes it a great place for photographers.
sources.shortName: The Comprehensive Kodaikanal Trip Guide

sources.snippet: With the beautiful Kurinji flowers and many trees, the park is well established in Kodaikanal. The park will be open from 9 AM to 5 PM. You can spend up to 3 hours peacefully in Chettiar Park.
sources.shortName: 15 Beautiful Tourist Places In Kodaikanal

places.name: Chettiar Park

reviews.text: Amazing place with good view... A small park can spend time with kids by sitting... Good

A good park to explore. The entry fee is ‚Çπ40/person. A beautiful collection of flowers and plants is there. A play area is also there with swing and slides. The outskirts of this park also has a pond.

The park offers some really beautiful spots for photography-lush greenery, natural light, and scenic views make it a perfect place for capturing nature shots or portraits. It's a peaceful environment, ideal for a relaxing walk or simply enjoying the outdoors.

However, the playground area could use some attention. The equipment is worn out, and some parts look a bit neglected. It doesn't feel very safe or clean for children to play. With some maintenance and care.

places.address: 7F2X+GF7, Chettiar Park Rd, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 678242, India

places.generalDescription: Coaker's Walk, constructed in 1872 by Lieutenant Coaker, is a popular one-kilometer long walkway offering stunning views of the valley and mountains. It is located just 500 meters away from Kodai Lake and provides an amphitheatrical view of the surrounding hill range. The walkway winds around Mount Nebo, starting near Van Allen Hospital and ending at St. Peter's Church, providing panoramic vistas of the plains.

sources.snippet: Embark on a magical stroll along Coaker‚Äôs Walk, a picturesque promenade that hugs the edge of Kodaikanal‚Äôs cliffs. As you tread this scenic pathway, panoramic vistas unfold before you, revealing breathtaking views of the valley below and the distant mountains that stand in stoic majesty. The refreshing breeze brushes against your skin, carrying with it a medley of fragrances from the surrounding pine forests.
sources.shortName: Stunning Places to Visit and Photograph in Kodaikanal, India

sources.snippet: Coaker‚Äôs Walk is a 1 km-long paved pedestrian path that was constructed by Lieutenant Coaker in 1872. It is a perfect place for enjoying the panoramic view of the valley and is probably the most scenic and popular tourist spot of the Kodaikanal. The lovely path of the spot is a heaven for nature lovers and is preferred for leisurely strolls and cyclists.
sources.shortName: 21 Best Places to Visit in Kodaikanal

sources.snippet: If there ever was a way to really feel the nature, this 1km long walking plaza carved in the mountains is definitely the closest experience. The walk offers some of the most splendid views you are ever likely to see and is always bustling with people. Constructed in 1872 by Lt. Coaker, is one of the most popular places to visit in Kodaikanal.
sources.shortName: Places to Visit in Kodaikanal in 2 Days

sources.snippet: Lieutenant Coaker constructed Coaker‚Äôs Walk in the year 1872 on the slopes of mountains for nature lovers. It is one of the best nature tourist destinations to visit around Kodaikanal. A long nature walks with your loved ones along with the most stunning views of the greenery and mountains will seduce your senses.
sources.shortName: 12 Best Places to Visit in Kodaikanal | Tamil Nadu

sources.snippet: Coaker‚Äôs walk is a popular walking trail that offers stunning views of the mountains and valley below. When the mist shrouds the rain-drenched mountains during the monsoon season, this place looks beautiful. Additionally, it provides a glittering view of Madurai during the night.
sources.shortName: The Comprehensive Kodaikanal Trip Guide

sources.snippet: Built by Lt Coaker in 1872, Coaker‚Äôs Walk is a constructed walking plaza that cannot be missed when you are holidaying in Kodaikanal. A popular tourist spot, it is around half a kilometre from Kodaikanal Lake. People are often seen taking morning or evening walks here.
sources.shortName: 37 Best Places to Visit in Kodaikanal

sources.snippet: Enjoy a mystic walk among the clouds at the Coakers walk, near Kodaikanal Lake. Nature enthusiasts and shutterbugs should not miss the place, for the view and ambience it offers are indescribable. Open from 7 am to 7 pm, the walkway is very near the Kodaikanal Lake.
sources.shortName: Kodaikanal | Hill Stations in Tamil Nadu

sources.snippet: If you don‚Äôt want to go to every place in Kodaikanal but need to enjoy all aspects of the places, Coaker‚Äôs walk is the right place. It is a good place for photography. Coaker‚Äôs walk has the telescope to explore a different angle of the hill station.
sources.shortName: 15 Beautiful Tourist Places In Kodaikanal

sources.snippet: A holiday in Kodaikanal is incomplete without a visit to the Coaker's Walk. A man-made walking plaza, Coaker's Walk was built by Lt Coaker in 1872. Today it is one of the most popular places to visit in Kodaikanal.
sources.shortName: Kodaikanal Tourism- Best Places to Visit in Kodaikanal

sources.snippet: Kodaikanal has been nicknamed ‚Äúthe Princess of Hill Stations‚Äù and a visit to Coaker‚Äôs Walk will tell you why. This approximately 1 km long walkway built on the slopes of a mount...
sources.shortName: 18 Tourist Places in Kodaikanal 2024: Entry Fee, Timings

places.name: Coaker's Walk

reviews.text:
For old times sake! Been visiting this place since childhood üôÇ
A kilometre long walk along the hill top, pleasant view & weather‚Ä¶the best during a sunrise or the evening blue hour.

The place could feel like a fair though, when crowded during long weekends or holiday seasons.
One of my best spot in Kodaikanal, must try in sunset/ evening with mist. Each time I had different experience.. Highly recommend üëçüëçüëç
Must recommended.Try early morning walk(Preferably during Pre-Monsoon time) ,experience calm and breathtaking views.

places.generalDescription: This falls is located in the hills near Kodaikanal and gets its water from Kodai Lake. The waterfall has a height of 180 meters, making it an attractive tourist spot. The falls can be seen from the roadside, and is a great place to take a dip if the weather is nice.

sources.snippet: The Silver Cascade Falls has located near the Kodaikanal entrance check post and is 9 km from Kodai Lake. The waterfall will make you fall in love at first sight. The waterfall is 180 feet high, which adds extra charm.
sources.shortName: 15 Beautiful Tourist Places In Kodaikanal

places.name: Silver Cascade Waterfall

reviews.text: Beautiful Water fall on the way to kodaikanal . The view is fantastic . The greenery around the area adds to the beauty . Hopefully we people should respect and preserve nature so that even our next , next to generation can see and enjoy the beauty of nature . There are many street shops were you can get many things as a souvenir, eatables , fancy items , etc . Its a stop worth getting down of the car and enjoy the moment with nature .

Visited Silver Cascade Waterfall early morning around 5:45 AM on 19th April 2025. The place was calm and peaceful at that time, with hardly any crowd. The sound of the waterfall and the fresh morning air made it a refreshing stop. A great spot to enjoy nature if you go early-later in the day, it tends to get very crowded and noisy. Highly recommend visiting in the early hours for the best experience.

Silver Cascade Waterfalls in Kodaikanal is a breathtaking natural wonder that offers a peaceful escape into nature. The cascading waters create a soothing ambiance, perfect for relaxation and contemplation. It's an incredibly attractive spot for photography, with the stunning backdrop of lush greenery and the shimmering falls. Additionally, playful monkeys can often be seen frolicking in the trees, adding a delightful touch to the experience. A must-visit for nature lovers and photographers alike!

places.generalDescription: Fairy Falls, also known as the Grand Cascade, is a seasonal waterfall located about 4 km from Kodaikanal Bus Station. It is formed by the overflow from a reservoir and can be reached by following a steep and slippery path behind the Pambar house. The falls offer a picturesque setting with an observation bridge and leafy surroundings, making it an ideal spot for nature lovers to unwind and observe. Visitors can enjoy picnics and various activities at the falls.

sources.snippet: Located around 6 KM away from Kodaikanal Bus Station and 5 KM away from Kodai Lake, one of the major attractions in Kodaikanal Fairy Falls is well connected via road to the town making reaching there hustle free. You can visit here any day of the week. Flowing in Pambarpuram area, this mesmerising waterfall is the source of Pamber river which later joins the river Vaigai.
sources.shortName: 35 Places to Visit in Kodaikanal, Tourist Places & Attractions

sources.snippet: Located in the Pambarpuram area, the Fairy Falls make for a must visit place in Kodaikanal. These cascading falls offers a beautiful sight of water gushing out at a heavy speed from the top of a mountain. The falls is also very popular as a point for swimming.
sources.shortName: Kodaikanal Tourism- Best Places to Visit in Kodaikanal

sources.snippet: Fairy Falls, as the name suggests, has an overabundance of exceptional beauty. Located in the Pambarpuram area, it is the major source of the Pambar River. Falling from the top of a mountain range, this falls creates an impressive view.
sources.shortName: 37 Best Places to Visit in Kodaikanal

sources.snippet: The town water reservoir overflows southwards forming the Fairy Falls which continues to join the Vaigai River forming the Pambar Falls through its course.
sources.shortName: 32 Best Places to Visit in Kodaikanal, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)
25 Best Places To Visit In Kodaikanal With Your Family And Friends 2024

places.name: Fairy Falls

reviews.text: Visited in last week of August. Not much water. Place looks abandoned, not maintained. The scenery around was beautiful.

Fairy Falls had very few visitors when I went because there was no water flowing at that time. It's probably best to visit during the monsoon season or after rainfall when the waterfall is active and more scenic. However, the atmosphere was still peaceful, with a touch of greenery around. It's a nice spot to relax and enjoy some quiet time without any disturbances.
It's good place if water flow Is enough. It's quite calm place to spend some time with nature

places.address: 6FF8+FQH, Fairy Falls Rd, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

places.generalDescription: Green Valley View Point, also known as Suicide Point, offers a breathtaking view of the plains and a 4,900-foot sheer drop. The drive to this viewpoint includes stops at Moir Point, Pine Forest for picnics, Guna Cave (only accessible for viewing), and Pillar Rocks with its stunning vertical boulders. Some viewpoints require additional walking or climbing uneven steps. Despite its reputation as a suicide spot, it now attracts tourists who come to admire the scenery.

sources.snippet: Green Valley View is amongst the very few places to visit in Kodaikanal that offers a bird‚Äôs eye view of the Vaigai Dam. Apart from that, it is a one-stop-shop to get a wholesome view of the enthralling greenery, the cloud-bound valley and the lush mountains behind.It is also amongst the dangerous viewpoints since the route up is tricky, and is on a great height which makes standing there also unsafe. The mist takes over the crowd post late afternoon, and that might disrupt the spectacle from there unless you are there for the haze.Location:5.5km from Kodaikanal Lake.Timing:07.00AM to 06.00PMEntry Fee: FreeHighly Recommended: Kodaikanal Couple Packages
sources.shortName: 35 Places to Visit in Kodaikanal, Tourist Places & Attractions

sources.snippet: Kodaikanal is home to two distinct Pine Forests: Pine Forest 1, which is adjacent to the Solar Observatory, and Pine Forest 2, situated near Moir Point. The landscape is adorned with numerous pine trees, creating a perfect environment for travelers to explore. Additionally, the forests are surrounded by a variety of mushrooms, commonly referred to as magic mushrooms, which are thought to possess hallucinogenic properties.
sources.shortName: 32 Best Places to Visit in Kodaikanal, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

sources.snippet: Presenting an incomparable view of the Vaigai Dam and the rich foliage around, Green Valley View is definitely a place one must visit while enjoying their time on Kodaikanal tour. Also known as Suicide Point, this place got its aberrant name owing to the depth and density of the valley which makes it dangerous as well. Situated about 5.5 km from the Kodaikanal Lake, it can be visited between 10 to 3 in the evening.
sources.shortName: 37 Best Places to Visit in Kodaikanal

sources.snippet: Also known as Suicide Point, Green Valley View presents series of stunning vistas of plains, valleys and hills together. This gorgeous view of Vaigai dam will be there to seduce you again whenever you think of coming to South India for holidays. There are many small shops located in your way from where you get oils, chocolates, tea powder etc.
sources.shortName: 12 Best Places to Visit in Kodaikanal | Tamil Nadu

sources.snippet: The place was formerly known as suicide point but was later changed to Green Valley Point for obvious reasons. The place is known for its panoramic views of the mountains and has an approximate 5000 feet drop from the top. One can also view the amazing pillar rocks which were scaled and hoisted by an English adventurer.
sources.shortName: Top 8 Places To Visit In Kodaikanal, The Princess Of Hill Stations

sources.snippet: A post shared by Ourtravelgram (Amit & Neha) (@travelistasforever). Kodaikanal is aptly called the ‚ÄúThe Gift of Forest‚Äù as it has so many fascinating places with captivating beauty. The Green Valley View is one such place offering a breathtaking view of the plains, deep valleys, and hills.
sources.shortName: 21 Best Places to Visit in Kodaikanal

sources.snippet: 3 km from city center 1 out of 35 Places To Visit in Kodaikanal. Green Valley View, or the otherwise known Suicide Point, is a magnificent spot in Kodaikanal, popular mainly for its enroute fun. One must walk through misty woodlands and panoramic walks to reach this heaven like spot.
sources.shortName: 35 Best Places to visit in Kodaikanal | Top Tourist Attractions

sources.snippet: Get a wholesome view of the consuming greenery, the cloud-blown valley, and the lush mountains behind. It is one of the great places to go in Kodaikanal.
sources.shortName: 18 Places to Visit in Kodaikanal in 2024

sources.snippet: Apart from that, it is a one-stop shop to get a full view of the beautiful jungle, the valley with clouds at its height and lush mountains behind.
sources.shortName: 25 Best Places To Visit In Kodaikanal With Your Family And Friends 2024

places.name: Green Valley View Point

reviews.text: One of the best places to stay in Kodaikanal with an amazing sunrise view. The only con is the crowd that starts coming during the day. So it's best to start early to enjoy your stay here.

Green Valley View Point is one of the must-visit spots in Kodaikanal! The view from the top is absolutely breathtaking ‚Äì a stunning panorama of the valleys and cliffs.

However, it was extremely crowded during my visit, and I had to wait around 10 minutes in a queue just to get to the viewpoint. That said, the path leading up is lined with small shops selling souvenirs and gift items at very reasonable prices ‚Äì much cheaper than other tourist spots.

Overall, despite the crowd, it's worth the wait for the fantastic view and a bit of budget shopping along the way!

Massive crowds on a Saturday. No tickets. Many shops. At the end of a path there are iron grills, beyond which valley begins.
Again, rainy season means clouds, fog and Mist. No views.
Monkeys in large number.
This place was once infamous as Suicide point, as a number of people ended their life here by jumping into the valley which drops nearly 5000 feet below.
